name: Courtyard Kuwait City

reviews.text: My company booked me in the Courtyard Marriott so it was not by choice. But I was impressed by the room which was spotless, the view which was gorgeous and the staff which were extremely generous. You have access to dry cleaning and breakfast each morning served at whatever time you choose.
reviews.title: Clean, Luxury and SUPER Service

reviews.text: There is a freaking mall attached to the hotel. So shopping at upscale stores like Burberry or Zegna are a 1-minute walk from your hotel room.
reviews.title: A very efficient business hotel

reviews.text: The room service is available 24 hours a day and includes Arabic and American food choices. There is a fitness center located in the hotel. The staff was always smiling and asking if I needed anything.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, reliable service

likes.liked: — generous space and being adjacent to an upscale mall

reviews.text: Stayed at the Courtyard twice during November, once for 1-night and then for 3-nights. In my opinion, it is a very useful business hotel (probably the preferred choice for business in Kuwait City and the financial area) and also a well-run hotel otherwise.
reviews.title: Not a bad place

reviews.text: I spent 3 days at this hotel; frankly speaking I was surprised by the excellent service and the friendly stuff. One of the best courtyard Marriott I have been stayed if it is not the best the glass lobby is unique as it is very bright, The break fast buffet is amazing and they have Avery nice dining Italian restaurant by the name of Il Forno
reviews.title: Modern Hotel, excellent for Business
Acceptable, better than others in Kuwait
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to all Kuwait visitors as it is apparently a four stars hotel but it has all the facilities of the 5 stars especially with the elegant club lounge in 15th floor

There are two Marriotts in Kuwait, which I discovered having spent 45 minutes being driven to the wrong one by a local taxi driver. That's the only strong piece of advice I can give you. Plus check your bill on checkout, as you might find you've been charged for your free transfer from the airport. You'll be refunded, but it's rather cheeky.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and excellent service

reviews.text: As I've mentioned in other reviews of Kuwait hotels, this is not somewhere one often chooses to visit so a comfortable hotel makes a difference to one's stay. The benefits of the Courtyard Marriott are its location and reasonable facilities. It's connected to a city centre mall which offers a few shopping and eating diversions at the end of the business day, although sterling has slid so far against the KD that buying anything was irresponsible except for therapeutic reasons. Inside the hotel there is a large lobby, an outdoor pool (which I didn't see) and a well equipped gym that's open 24 hours a day. Internet is free and it's a reasonable connection. These are the sort of thing that make me recommend this rather than, say, the Holiday Inn Downtown.
reviews.title: Brilliant service

likes.disliked: — Location is unknown to most taxi drivers

reviews.text: The staff (as always, not Kuwaiti nationals) are friendly and sometimes efficient. The lifts take a couple of uses to get too - it's the first time I've encountered ones where you type your destination floor onto a keypad, are allocated a lift, and then find there are no buttons inside! Beware that some rooms face onto the atrium rather than out to the city.
reviews.title: A bit overrated here but nice.

reviews.text: The hotel is comfortable and clean in the Sharq district of Kuwait City. The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are well kept. There is a pretty good Italian restaurant near the main lobby that has excellent food and good service. For those who are staying more than a night or two, however, the only other dining choice in the hotel is another lobby restaurant that serves typical buffet fare. Although there is a shopping mall attached to the hotel, there didn't seem to be any restaurants there that were more than fast food or coffee shops. You can't go terribly wrong if you stay at the Courtyard, but I am sure there are better hotels in Kuwait City.
reviews.title: A Decent Hotel in a Quiet City

reviews.text: I went to kuwait for a conference.I spent 4 days there (wished to spend my entire life there).This is the best hotel in kuwait. First I found a luxury car waiting for me at the airport on time,then I was impressed by the perfect location, gorgeous view, brilliant friendly staff, great food and excellent service.A great mall is attached to the hotel where I enjoyed shopping.When I was leaving, another luxury car drove me to the airport.
reviews.title: Excellent Service and Outstanding Friendly Stuff

reviews.text: My colleague was surprised to find a great delicious birthday cake at her room with a nice note.The staff was very nice and found out that it was her birthday from the passport :)
reviews.title: Looks can be deceiving....

reviews.text: This hotel looks absolutely fantastic as compared to Courtyard hotels in the States. However, I've had some bad experiences on several stays here. I had to stay a number of times because my company uses this property, but I couldn't recommend it- especially for women travelling alone.
reviews.title: Good standard of accomodation, with amenities to match

reviews.text: 1. First stay- awful food poisoning (fever, chills, stomach, etc.) Think it was from room service...
reviews.title: Amazing
The best Courtyard I have stayed at
reviews.text: Normally I associate Courtyard with a pitstop somewhere in the USA. Normally they are a reasonably good and safe bet - not this Courtyard.

reviews.title: Wonderful service, beautiful hotel
reviews.text: This is by far the best Courtyard I have stayed at bar none.The rooms were clean,large,functional and well equiped.

description: Courtyard by Marriott Kuwait City is a high rise modern building located in the heart of Kuwait City. With its 313 rooms, it offers modern facilities and services including high speed internet access, business centre, and 24 hour rooms service. The hotel offers a complimentary airport shuttle service. Dining options at the hotel include The Atrium, an International all day restaurant and lounge; Il Forno, an Italian restaurant; and Tiramisu, the lobby lounge.
